basics.name: Kevin Lin
basics.label: Java Software Engineer, Developer
basics.summary: I am a full stack Java developer with 8 years of work experience who regards building high-quality and valuable software systems as the very essence of my career. I love to combine all sorts of suitable technologies - traditional or cutting-edge - to realise fantastic ideas or to take existing projects to the next level. It's a great joy for me being a contributive, cooperative team player and making our projects increasingly powerful, robust, and profitable.

work.summary: Work across multiple agile teams delivering both green-field insurance sales projects and enhancements.
highlights: (Dev) Core developer of "Reimagine" projects - re-built and maintain AAMI, GIO, SUN and APIA motor insurance sales sites from ground-up with React and SpringBoot.
(DevOps) Create and maintain prod and non-prod CI/CD infrustructure for multiple projects, and being responsible for prod and non-prod releases.
Tech-lead of two optimisation (features) teams, host daily knowledge sharing sessions (tech huddle)
On-call support for insurance sales related projects.
Relevant Skills: React, Java, Spring Boot, Node.js, Jenkins, AWS, Azure, Groovy, Python, JUnit, Jest, Maven, Gradle, Splunk, etc.

work.summary: Worked in agile and waterfall teams as a solution finder and problem solver, being responsible for developing, enhancing and maintaining the company's new and existing projects.
highlights: Created and being the core developer of RDSWB (Relational Data Systems Workflow Builder), a multi-module and pluggable web system that provides drag-and-drop components for creating large, complex and dynamic forms, as well as to design, deploy, and run workflows.
Maintain Jenkins jobs for RDSWB continuous delivery.

Maintain and enhance the Integrated Land Information Systems in both SA and NT. Typical tasks are upgrading forms and BPM processes using RDSWB, migrating workflow data, developing new features, fixing bugs and so on.
Developed E-Value, a sub-system that works with SAILIS for property valuation.
Develop quick, proof-of-concept prototypes for new projects.
Relevant Skills: Java, AngularJS, Spring, Spring MVC, Spring Boot, Flowable, Node.js, Schema Form, Ajv, Gulp, Bower, Express, EJS, JUnit, Karma, Jasmine, Maven, Jenkins, Oracle, Docker, AWS, etc.

work.summary: Worked on project WaterMe, the company's online irrigation controller system.
highlights: Developed weather condition and forecast data module that retrieves data from Weather Underground API to enhance automatic watering.
Optimised the system's performance, reducing its queries per second from 3000 to 600.
Added international languages support.
Migrated the server to AWS.
Relevant Skills: Java, AngularJS, Spring, Hibernate, JUnit, Node.js, Bower, Karma, Jasmine, JUnit, Maven, AWS, CentOS, Tomcat, MySQL, etc.

work.summary: I was responsible for building, hosting and maintaining our own company's web store (www.textbookmango.com) that rents and sells textbooks to university students.
highlights: Developed front-end CMS pages and promotion widgets.
Developed back-end functions such as book management, rented books tracking, and promotion management.
Integrated our website with eWAY.
Deployed and hosted the website using Git on a CentOS LAMP environment.
Relevant Skills: JavaScript, Java, PHP, Magento, Shell Scripting, CasperJS, OpenCSV, Git, LAMP, CentOS, etc.

work.summary: Worked in IBM Systems Lab Services as a front-end developer for IBM SCE (Smart Cloud Environment, an IaaS platform), as well as being responsible for researching and developing subsidiary projects for IBM SDC (Smart Data Centre).
highlights: Created and maintained reusable front-end components for IBM SCE with Dojo.
Planned the architecture and worked out the 3D presentation solutions for the IBM SDC data visualisation applications using WebGL and VTK.
Developed OpenFOAM mesh and boundary condition generation tool that works with VTK to visualise data centre temperature and wind data.
Optimised the data centre sensors control module which increased the data collection rate by 6 times.
Relevant Skills: Java, Struts 2, Spring, Hibernate, JSP, JavaScript, WebGL, Dojo, VTK, OpenFoam, Swing, JWS, etc.

work.company: Beijing Yonyou Audit Software Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Worked as a Java programmer for the maintenance and new feature development tasks of UFIDA Online Audit System, a Java C/S system based on UAP-NC platform focusing on massive audit data collecting and analysing
highlights: Maintained the “Query Engine” module which helps users with no or limited SQL knowledge to browse, analyse and report audit data.
Participated in the whole process upgrading our product from version 5.0 to 5.5. Designed and implemented new features according to user requirements.
Promoted code review and code refactoring in our team.
Relevant Skills: Java, Swing, JWS, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS, Struts, Spring, Hibernate, SQL, Oracle, etc.
Helped the Business Council to set up the venue for the business migration, investment and trade exposition.
Assisted the local council members and business representatives from Mount Barker during the event, providing translation service between them and the Chinese business delegates.

awards.title: Outstanding Performance
awards.summary: Personal Business Contribution Assessment Level 1 - Outstanding (Top 5%)

awards.title: Best Newcomer of The Year
awards.awarder: Beijing Yonyou Audit Software Co., Ltd.
